launchSites.location: Satish Dhawan Space Centre SHAR, Sriharikota

launches.missionDescription: Faulty valve caused vehicle to crash into the Bay of Bengal 317 seconds after launch.
launches.notes: Developmental Flight. Faulty valve and wrong assessment causes vehicle to crash into the Bay of Bengal (317 s after takeoff)

launches.missionDescription: First satellite successfully launched by the indigenous launch vehicle SLV.
launches.notes: Developmental Flight

launches.missionDescription: Orbit too low. Decayed after 9 days
launches.notes: Did not reach intended height. Satellite only orbits for 9 days, Developmental Flight
Developmental Flight

launches.missionDescription: First stage failed to ignite after launch
launches.notes: First stage did not ignite after strap-on burnout, Developmental Flight

launches.missionDescription: Control problems caused launcher to disintegrate
launches.notes: Insufficient control gain, Developmental Flight

launches.missionDescription: Orbit lower than expected and incorrect spin-stabilization. Decayed quickly.
launches.notes: Lower than expected orbit and incorrect spin-stabilisation, payload decayed quickly

launches.missionDescription: Maiden flight; Attitude control failure at second stage separation.
launches.notes: Unexpected large disturbance at the second stage separation resulting in a sub-orbital flight

launches.missionDescription: With the successful launch, India became the sixth country in the world to launch satellite in low-Earth orbit

launches.notes: PSLV placed the 922 kg IRS-P3 satellite in the intended 817 km polar orbit

launches.missionDescription: First operational flight; Fourth stage under-performed resulting in lower than planned orbit. Satellite used own propulsion to move to correct orbit.
launches.notes: PSLV's first operational flight, placed IRS-1D into a polar orbit. However, it did not place the satellite in the desired circular orbit of 817 km, but in an elliptical orbit due to a leak of helium gas from one of the components

launches.missionDescription: First launch to have foreign satellites, and first to carry multiple satellites
launches.notes: PSLV's first commercial launch and also was for the first time an Indian launch vehicle carried multiple satellites

launches.missionDescription: Developmental flight, payload placed into lower than planned orbit
launches.notes: Payload placed into lower than planned orbit, and did not have sufficient fuel to reach a usable orbit
Placed three satellites in orbit - TES of India, PROBA of the European Space Agency and the BIRD of Germany
India's first launch to place a satellite into a Geosynchronous Transfer Orbit
Developmental Flight

launches.missionDescription: Launch took place despite heavy rain
launches.notes: Payload capability had been progressively increased by more than 600 kg since the first PSLV launch
First operational flight

launches.missionDescription: First PSLV launch from the second launch pad
launches.notes: First launch from the Second Launch Pad, inaugurated on the immediately preceding day

launches.missionDescription: Both rocket and satellite had to be destroyed over the Bay of Bengal after the rocket's trajectory veered outside permitted limits
launches.notes: One of the L40 strap-on engines failed at lift-off

launches.missionDescription: First flight of hardware upgrade, first launch of reentry capsule (SRE)
launches.notes: For the first time, a Dual Launch Adopter (DLA) was used in the PSLV to accommodate two primary satellites at the same time
First flight of the 'Core-Alone' configuration

launches.missionDescription: Successful Launch, apogee lower and inclination higher than expected
launches.notes: Due to minor error in guidance subsystem. Eventually the 2160 kg payload reached the designated geostationary transfer orbit
An Israeli reconnaissance satellite, and ISRO's first fully commercial launch

launches.missionDescription: Rocket put 10 satellites into orbit in a precisely timed sequence
launches.notes: Highest number of satellites by any Indian launch vehicle at that time

launches.missionDescription: First flight of the PSLV-XL configuration, first Indian Lunar probe
launches.notes: India's first mission to the Moon launched

launches.missionDescription: India's first radar imaging satellite, RISAT
launches.notes: India's first all weather observation spy satellite RISAT-2 launched
SwissCube-1 and ITUpSAT1, Switzerland's and Turkey's first home-grown satellites launched into space

launches.missionDescription: First flight test of the ISRO designed and built Cryogenic Upper Stage (CUS)
launches.notes: Failed to reach orbit due to malfunction of the Fuel Booster Turbo Pump (FBTP) of the cryogenic upper stage

launches.missionDescription: Multi-satellite launch including second Swiss satellite
launches.notes: Main satellite Cartosat-2B and Algeria's ALSAT-2A along with AISSat-1, TIsat-1, and StudSat. TIsat-1 is the second ever Swiss satellite launched into Space
Destroyed by range safety officer after loss of control of liquid fuelled boosters
The standard version, with six solid strap-on booster motors strung around the first stage, was used

launches.missionDescription: First use of Vikram flight computer
launches.notes: Indigenously developed flight computer 'Vikram' used for the first time
The Megha-Tropiques satellite for climate research launched along with three microsatellites
RISAT-1 launched
ISRO's 100th mission

launches.missionDescription: Indo-French SARAL and six other foreign satellites launched
launches.notes: First Austrian satellites launched

launches.missionDescription: Launch of IRNSS-1A, the first satellite of the Indian Regional Navigation Satellite System
launches.notes: First satellite of the Indian Regional Navigation Satellite System

launches.missionDescription: Launch of GSLV with indigenously built cryogenic engine
launches.notes: Second flight of GSLV with indigenous cryogenic upper stage developed by ISRO's Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre

launches.missionDescription: Mars Orbiter Mission or Mangalyaan, India's first mission to Mars
launches.notes: India's first Mars mission
IRNSS-1B, the second out of seven in the Indian Regional Navigation Satellite System (IRNSS) launched
Five foreign satellites including France's SPOT-7 launched

launches.missionDescription: Sub-orbital developmental test flight with a non-functional cryogenic stage
launches.notes: It carried the CARE module and was a sub-orbital development test flight
IRNSS-1C, the third out of seven in the Indian Regional Navigation Satellite System (IRNSS) launched
IRNSS-1D, the fourth out of seven in the Indian Regional Navigation Satellite System (IRNSS) launched

launches.missionDescription: Heaviest commercial mission at the time
launches.notes: At the time it was the heaviest commercial mission successfully accomplished using a launch vehicle assembled by ISRO

launches.missionDescription: Second successful launch of GSLV with indigenous cryogenic upper stage
launches.notes: GSAT-6 launched and second successful launch of GSLV with indigenous cryogenic upper stage (CE-7.5)

launches.missionDescription: Launch of India's first dedicated astronomy satellite
launches.notes: Launch of India's first dedicated astronomy satellite Astrosat and ISRO's first launch of US satellites
Commercial launch of 6 Singaporean satellites. Fourth stage re-ignition demonstrated successfully after payload deployment
IRNSS-1E, the fifth out of seven in the Indian Regional Navigation Satellite System (IRNSS) launched
IRNSS-1F, the sixth out of seven in the Indian Regional Navigation Satellite System (IRNSS) launched

launches.missionDescription: Final navigation satellite launch completing the IRNSS constellation
launches.notes: IRNSS-1G, the last out of seven in the Indian Regional Navigation Satellite System (IRNSS) launched. System named NAVIC

launches.missionDescription: First test flight of reusable launch vehicle
launches.notes: RLV-TD is one of the most technologically challenging endeavors of ISRO towards developing essential technologies for a fully reusable launch vehicle
Simultaneous launch of 20 satellites including 17 foreign satellites, 2 student satellites and Cartosat-2C

launches.missionDescription: First mission with payloads into two different orbits
launches.notes: First mission of PSLV to launch its payloads into two different orbits

launches.missionDescription: First operational flight of GSLV Mk II with indigenous CUS
launches.notes: First operational flight of GSLV Mk II
First mission of PSLV to use India's own regional navigation system (NavIC) to navigate PSLV

launches.missionDescription: Record 104 satellites deployed in single mission
launches.notes: Successfully carried and deployed a record 104 satellites including Cartosat-2D in the polar Sun-synchronous orbit
Launch of GSAT-9 / South Asia Satellite

launches.missionDescription: First orbital test launch of GSLV Mk. III with a functional cryogenic stage
launches.notes: Launch of GSAT-19 satellite
Post mission PSLV fourth stage (PS4) was lowered to 350 km altitude and carried IDEA payload to measure electron density and electric field measurements
Payload fairing (heat shield) failed to separate, causing the IRNSS-1H satellite to remain inside the fairing
Used an enhanced version of the Vikas engine called High Thrust Vikas Engine (HTVE) which had a thrust of 848 kN in GS2 stage

satellites.name: Cubesats
satellites.note: Including PicSat, SIGMA, CANYVAL-X, CNUSail 1, KAUSAT 5

launches.notes: Simultaneous launch of 31 satellites including 28 foreign satellites and ISRO's 100th satellite Cartosat-2F
Launch of IRNSS-1I, the ninth satellite of Indian Regional Navigation Satellite System (IRNSS)
Launch of NovaSAR and S1-4 of Surrey Satellite Technology
Launch of GSAT-29

launches.missionDescription: Launch of HySIS and commercial satellites
launches.notes: Launch of 9 Commercial Satellites and HySIS
Used an enhanced version of the Vikas engine called High Thrust Vikas Engine (HTVE) along with uprated cryogenic engine C15
First flight of PSLV-DL variant. Propellant tank on fourth stage (PS4) made out of Aluminum alloy instead of Ti-6Al-4V

launches.missionDescription: Launch of EMISAT and commercial satellites
launches.notes: Flight C45. EMISAT (436 kg) and rideshares (220 kg)
Launch of RISAT-2B
Launch of Chandrayaan-2
Semi-Conductor Laboratory fabricated Vikram 1601 processor used for first time in navigation computer of launch vehicle
Flight C48 - 50th Flight of PSLV
Second flight of PSLV-DL variant
Launch of communication satellite CMS-01

launches.missionDescription: Launch of Amazonia-1 and commercial satellites
launches.notes: Launch of Amazonia-1 and 13 commercial satellites

launches.missionDescription: Launch of EOS-03 geostationary imaging satellite
launches.notes: Cryogenic upper stage failure resulted in mission failure
Launch of EOS-4/RISAT-1A, INSPIRESat-1 and INS-2TD
Launch of DS-EO electro-optical satellite and two other small satellites from Singapore. Carried PSLV Orbital Experimental Module (POEM) that is attached to upper stage

First demonstration flight of SSLV which carried the satellite payloads EOS 02 and AzaadiSAT. Due to sensor failure coupled with shortcomings of onboard software, the stage as well as the two satellite payloads were injected into an unstable elliptical orbit
Carried 36 OneWeb Satellites. First commercial launch of LVM 3. It is the heaviest payload that is launched by a LVM 3 and ISRO to date

launches.missionDescription: Launch of EOS-06 and commercial satellites
launches.notes: Launch of the EOS-06/Oceansat-3 satellite and 8 commercial cubesats
Launch of EOS-07 and two other satellites
Second batch of 36 OneWeb Gen-1 satellites launched successfully to low earth orbit of 450 km with 87.4 inclination
First launch operation of a rocket partially assembled at PSLV Integration Facility (PIF). First flight of PSLV-CA without Aerodynamic Stabiliser (AST) modules
NVS-01 is the first in the second generation navigational satellites. It carried navigational payload operating in L1,L5 and s bands
Commercial launch for Singapore's DS-SAR satellite
The rocket successfully injected a lunar composite spacecraft of Propulsion Module-Lander-Rover into an elliptical parking orbit
Solar coronal observation mission

launches.missionDescription: Test flight for crew abort system
launches.notes: Suborbital. High altitude abort test for the Gaganyaan crew spacecraft
Launch of the XPoSat scientific mission
Follow on mission to INSAT-3DR. In this mission, a new white coloured C15 stage was introduced which has more environmental-friendly manufacturing processes

launches.missionDescription: The SSLV-D3 placed EOS-08 and SR-O Demosat precisely into the orbit.
launches.notes: This flight completes the SSLV Development Project and enables operational missions by Indian industry and NSIL.

launches.missionDescription: PSLV-C59 vehicle carried Proba-3 spacecraft into a highly elliptical orbit as a Dedicated commercial mission of NewSpace India Limited (NSIL)
launches.notes: Proba-3 is an In-Orbit Demonstration (IOD) mission of the European Space Agency. The mission goal is to demonstrate precise formation flying. It consists of 2 spacecrafts launched in a stacked configuration.
